com.github.tommyettinger.iconizer - package com.github.tommyettinger.iconizer
 
confineLowerHalf(long, int) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.iconizer.Iconizer
Given a long x and an int bound, this randomly scrambles the low bits of x, so it produces an int between 0 (inclusive) and bound (exclusive).
confineUpperHalf(long, int) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.iconizer.Iconizer
Given a long x and an int bound, this randomly scrambles the low bits of x, so it produces an int between 0 (inclusive) and bound (exclusive).

G

generate(int, int, long) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.iconizer.Iconizer
Creates a new Pixmap with the given width and height, using the given long seed to randomly select colors and halves of icons to draw.
generate(int, int, Object...) - Method in class com.github.tommyettinger.iconizer.Iconizer
Hashes the given seeds and calls generate(int, int, long) with the hashed seed.

H

hsl2rgb(float, float, float, float) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.iconizer.Iconizer
Converts the four HSLA components, each in the 0.0 to 1.0 range, to a packed float in RGBA format.

I

Iconizer - Class in com.github.tommyettinger.iconizer
Loads an OpenMoji atlas when created, then allows icons to be generated with generate(int, int, long).
Iconizer() - Constructor for class com.github.tommyettinger.iconizer.Iconizer
Creates an Iconizer and loads its TextureAtlas from the classpath.

scramble(long) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.iconizer.Iconizer
Given a long x, this randomly scrambles x, so it is (almost always) a very different long.
scramble(Object) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.iconizer.Iconizer
Hashes o and scrambles the hash with scramble(long).
scramble(Object, Object) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.iconizer.Iconizer
Scrambled and hashes o1 and o2 with scramble(long).
scrambleAll(Object...) - Static method in class com.github.tommyettinger.iconizer.Iconizer
Scrambled and hashes every Object in os, using the previous hashes to modify the input to the next hash, and so on.
